body: @tjgq @coeuvre Do you happen to have any idea how this could happen? I tried to reproduce it locally in various situations (tests timing out before they touch the file, various remote output modes), but failed. This keeps happening both on Bazel itself and other projects.

I've observed some tests that fail to startup properly and exit 1 before touching the sharding support file. This causes the real error to be hidden, and only the sharding support error message to be displayed in the log.

I propose that Bazel only verifies the sharding file if the test passes.

issue.title: Only check for shard status file if a test passed

labels.name: team-OSS
labels.description: Issues for the Bazel OSS team: installation, release processBazel packaging, website

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
If a test fails, the failure is going to be informative than a generic exec error and the failure may have interrupted or prevented the test runner from touching the status file.

Speculatively fixes #22028

body: Good idea, let's try that first and see whether any failures remain with it: https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/pull/22098
